intro: Alsinanthe stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf alsin, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Alsinanthe stricta is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and dry slopes.
